conclusion: Introduction to the problem and setup description.
Metal shaft OO' rotates, metal rod M is perpendicular and slides on ring N.
Uniform magnetic field with magnitude B₀ parallel to OO'.
Voltmeter V connected between OO' and ring N, reads U₀ at angular velocity ω₀.
Voltage is generated by M cutting magnetic field lines, inducing emf.
Visualization of OO' rotating, M sliding on N, possibly a circular ring.
Magnetic field is perpendicular to M.
Induced emf in M can be found using ε = B lv sinθ.
Velocity v of end of M sliding on N is v = ωR.
Induced emf ε = B₀ R² ω.
Voltmeter reads U₀ when ω = ω₀, so U₀ = B₀ R² ω₀.
For new magnetic field nB₀, mU₀ = nB₀ R² ω_new.
Solve for ω_new: ω_new = m ω₀ / n.
Verification of steps and consistency check.
Final conclusion: angular velocity should be (m/n) ω₀.
